item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2425-2426; text as passed Senate: CR S2425-2426; text of measure as introduced: CR S2424)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2425-2426; text as passed Senate: CR S2425-2426; text of measure as introduced: CR S2424)

summary.text: Congratulates Graceland (the home of Elvis Presley from 1957 through 1977) on the occasion of its designation as a National Historic Landmark.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Recognizes Graceland (the home of Elvis Presley from 1957 through 1977) as exceptionally valuable for promoting and illustrating the contributions of Elvis Presley to the music and popular culture of the United States.

Acknowledges the importance of designating Graceland as a National Historic Landmark for the purposes of recognizing and preserving that unique cultural attraction.

Congratulates Graceland on the occasion of its designation as a National Historic Landmark.

bill.title: A resolution congratulating Graceland on the occasion of its designation as a National Historic Landmark.

item.title: A resolution congratulating Graceland on the occasion of its designation as a National Historic Landmark.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
